body: The bug is that parametrize overrides the scope, this should break at collection

Hi @RonnyPfannschmidt , for now the workaround is something similar to TestScenario2 which avoid using func_dep, but I would have to duplicate func_dep definition at class level.

Is this a parametrize feature bug?

Thanks.
Hi @RonnyPfannschmidt, the repro code is further simplifed. It looks like the parametrize for class fixture is totally broken.

Hi @reverseark,

Add `scope="class"` to your parametrize definition, then it works:

```
.tmp\test_class_fix_scope.py::TestScenario::test_foo[10] Fixture setup
PASSED
.tmp\test_class_fix_scope.py::TestScenario::test_bar[10] PASSED
.tmp\test_class_fix_scope.py::TestScenario::test_foo[20] Fixture setup
PASSED
.tmp\test_class_fix_scope.py::TestScenario::test_bar[20] PASSED
``` 

But it seems to be a bug `parametrize` is not using `class_dep`'s scope automatically.

Hmm yep, there's a bug in the function which finds the parametrization scope when it is not explicitly given. It takes all fixtures used by the function, not only those in the parametrization definition, which causes it to look at `class_dep` and `func_dep` used by `test_foo` and decide that it should use the narrower scope, `function`.

Hi @nicoddemus, thanks a lot for the explanation. My knowledge around parametrize is limited and am glad to learn explicit scope setting is actually supported for parametrize, as a very neat workaround in this case.

issue.title: Fix scope determination with indirect parameters

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

body: Sure thing @reverseark, thanks for taking the time to narrow down the example, we always appreciate that. PR with fix in #3987.

issue.title: Pytest 3.8.1 breaks scoped yield?

labels.name: status: needs information
labels.description: reporter needs to provide more information; can be closed after 2 or more weeks of inactivity

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Hi! 

pytest 3.8.1 on ubuntu 18.04 introduced some breaking changes in my codebase. The following used to work with 3.8.0:

```python
# conftest.py
@pytest.fixture(scope='session')
def driver():
    """Selenium headless Chrome webdriver fixture."""
    # just Chrome for now
    options = ChromeOptions()
    options.headless = True
    options.add_argument("--disable-dev-shm-usage")
    options.add_argument("--no-sandbox")
    driver = Chrome(options=options)

    yield driver

    # Quit the webdriver instance
    driver.quit()

@pytest.fixture
def browser(driver, request):
    """Fixture for browser that takes a screenshot on error.
    """
    yield driver

    _take_screenshot_if_test_failed(driver, request)


def _take_screenshot_if_test_failed(driver, request):
    """Take a screenshot if the test failed.
    """
    if request.node.rep_call.failed:
        # take screenshot
        pass

# test_file.py
def test_frontpage(live_server, browser):
    """Test retrieval of front page."""
    browser.get('<url>')

    search_form = browser.find_element_by_css_selector('form[role="search"]')
    assert search_form.get_attribute("action").endswith("intentional error")
```
By "used to work" I mean, if there was an error in the test case, a screenshot would be taken. 
In particular `request.node.rep_call` is not an attribute on `Function` or `Session` anymore (at least that is what the interpreter is saying).

Now the `_take_screenshot_if_test_failed(driver, request)` call is only executed at session teardown even if the `browser` fixture is function scoped. I probably don't understand how fixture scopes are supposed to work. How would I get back the ability to screenshot only for errors? 

`live_server` comes from `pytest-flask`

Thanks for clarifying things if this is not a bug!
